channel.title: I need help knowing how to do auto color like on an auto wcer or autominer
channel.description: If You know something that I do not about that auto color...well not auto, but what is the procedure for the color picker thing...please post im going to try to make an auto varrock yew cutter/banker. please post all useful procedures that i might need...And should i make it free if its really good?...or sell it...and if i did...would you buy it.. :confused: :D

item.title: I need help knowing how to do auto color like on an auto wcer or autominer
item.dc:creator: @Home Home
item.description:
@Home wrote:

That is most importan part… That GetSymbol color is Function From SRL it uses bitmaps…
BankSym:=GetSymbolColor(x,y,‘bank’);

On that

BankSym : = Getsymbolcolor('bank) it makes it to declare my bank symbol color as just founded color…

You can use like

CrownColor:=GetColor(tx,ty);

That uses exact coords to get color

Example :

CrownColor:=GetColor(100,45);

Now it finds and declares Crown Color as From founded coordintes(100,45)

if(FindBitmap(Bitmap, x, y, 570, 5, 725, 160, 70, 0))
then
OurColor := GetColor(x, y);
end;

(I am not sure about those procedures… but i hope you get point… 4:38 am here, tried :P)

item.source: I need help knowing how to do auto color like on an auto wcer or autominer

item.title: I need help knowing how to do auto color like on an auto wcer or autominer
item.dc:creator: @Home Home
item.description:
@Home wrote:

I show you an small example

[scar]begin
MarkTime(Mark);
repeat
wait(10)
until(findsymbol(x,y,‘bank’) or(TimeFromMark(Mark)>12000))
BankSym:=GetSymbolColor(x,y,‘bank’);
if(BankSym = 0) then
begin
writeln(‘Could Not Get Bank Color… Restart Script’); TerminateScript;
end;
writeln(‘BankColor:’+IntToStr(BankSym)+’ ;’);
end;[/scar]

Read full topic
